cs0x65.parkinglot.impl

Class ParkingLot

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs0x65.parkinglot.impl.ParkingLot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parkable<Car,Ticket>

    public class ParkingLot
extends Object
implements Parkable<Car,Ticket>
    The class represents the parking lot that provides the certain number of parking slots to park the cars. The other characteristics, typical of the parking lot are also captured like - parking rate etc. ParkingLot.ParkedTimeUnit specifies the time unit used for measuring the parked time duration. For simplicity, the class keeps a single field - that let us specify the time unit for both initial and subsequent durations. But it's totally possible to use different time units for the initial and subsequent durations. This can be done by introducing two distinct fields and corresponding setters like - setParkedTimeUnitInitialDuration() & setParkedTimeUnitSubsequentDuration(). For e.g. parked time unit for initial duration can be HOUR whereas that for the subsequent duration can be MINUTE.

      static class  ParkingLot.Builder
      The builder class that helps build the instance of the ParkingLot class for the given criteria/configuration.
      static class  ParkingLot.ParkedTimeUnit
      The enum captures the unit applied to while measuring the parked time of a car at a given parking slot.

      • leave

        public Ticket leave(Car car)
        A convenient method to un-park a car without requiring to specify the duration for which it was parked. The method marks the exit time of the car by calling Ticket.setLeftAt(long) on the corresponding Ticket instance.
        Parameters:
        car - the car being un-parked from the lot.
        Returns:
        the ticket corresponding to the parked car which is slated to leave.

      • status

        public String status(boolean includeEmptySlots)
        A utility method to get the formatted text representation of the current status of the parking lot.
        The formatted text contains two columns/headers: the 1st column is Slot No. & 2nd Registration No. with each entry on a separate row.

        Note: If the parking slot is empty & includeEmptySlots=true, it's represented as "--" under the 2nd column, whereas if includeEmptySlots=false then the slot entry is all together dropped from the status.

        E.g. if the parking lot has 3 slots and if 2nd slot is empty, then the status looks like:

        with includeEmptySlots=true
        Slot No. Registration No.
        1 MH-12-AB-1234
        2 --
        3 MH-13-AC-9999


        with includeEmptySlots=false, 2nd slot is dropped from the status info.
        Slot No. Registration No.
        1 MH-12-AB-1234
        3 MH-13-AC-9999
        Specified by:
        status in interface Parkable<Car,Ticket>
        Parameters:
        includeEmptySlots - specifies whether the status information shall include empty slots.
        Returns:
        the formatted text that captures the current status of the parking lot.

      • getNearestAvailableSlotIndex

        public int getNearestAvailableSlotIndex()
        Returns:
        the index of the nearest slot from the entry that's available to park an incoming car.
